p.s: The article Hope of escape lost in translation by Zia Haider Rahman was published in the Sunday Times at the 17t December 2016.
The text is about the advantages of learning English when one lives in London.
Zia talks about her own experiences with English as a kid and what helped her to learn the language.
At first the author talks about the high costs that were spent just on translating and interpreting and that we send the immigrant communities the wrong signals.
In the second paragraph Zia explains the situation in Brick Lane in the Easteast of London.
There the community does not have to learn English because everything is in Bengali.
In this part of London is a high crime rate and the people who live there don't have many choices on what to do with their lifeslives.
Then Zia talks about her own experiences in learning English.
Her parents always wanted her to learn this language and achieved this through the head of her primary school.
In addition, Rahman does not think it helps when you celebrate differences.
In the last paragraph she explains that it is important to celebrate diversity, which helps communities to integrate.
In addition one has to speak up to change something.
The author thinks it is very important to learn English when one wants to integrate in a country.
The consequences are no employment, no integration and a huge gap between two communities.
